Dead by Daylight has always been one of my favorite games. Well balanced, and unique matches that help with every play style for this game. I would keep my positive review that I originally had for this game but honestly, this game is falling apart and it all starts with BHVR (the devs). They dont listen to their community what so ever. We ask them for little things and then they go and do something completely random like change the HUD and UI (most recent update btw). Yeah, the HUD is cool and the UI is just okay but that is not what we are asking for. We want them to just focus on the real issues like more balance to the game so that both sides have respectable chances to win and ultimately have fun in the end. The biggest issue right now is the massive hit-box that killers have right now with this new update. If you are soon to be new to game, it will be a wild, emotional journey for you because being low rank is no fun because of campers and then being high rank can either be fun (expected) with no camping and tunneling or you will just get the same thing you got at low ranks with camping and tunneling. My hours are low here on steam but I have over a thousand hours combined with console.

I'm going to admit that previously I didn't recommend this game. However, I revise my review and now feel like I can recommend this game. Over the last year this game has made huge steps and no longer fully lives up to the memes. 
I enjoy this game alot and I think if you give it a chance, you will too.

Yes, it's a still buggy here are there, yes there are balancing issues and yes the game can seem grindy at times, but it's a vast improvement.

My opinions on the design of the characters has never changed, I think the devs do a great job with the licenses killers and I think their own creations are even better.

I would like to see more objective wise, I think once you've finished your 100,000th generator you're good....

Yeah, I'd say buy this game. It's a bit of a mess and the developers aren't always the brightest but it's unique. I've never had more fun or been more frustrated in one night than with Dead by Daylight. It's addicting and it sucks you in faster than you'll realize. Charming and fun for the most part. There's no game I'd rather spend my extra hours on.

Frustrating after many hours, but fun and addicting. PvP games are hard to balance so don't expect perfection. Best with friends and without the mindset of 'winning' or getting those 4 kills. 

As for the DbD community... yikes. Stay positive and don't be a d!ck, cheers.

The core game mechanics are there but the type of experience that you have depends on the players. I've played games where the killer killed all of the players except me and took me to a hatch to let me crawl escape on a live twitch stream. I've played games where all players work together and even stay to help hooked survivors after the exit gates have opened. I've played games where the players encourage you to get better and give you tips. I've also played games where people bitch, moan, and complain because they either don't know the game mechanics or want to abuse it killer or otherwise. As you know, there is a toxicity problem in this game.

You want to know the solution? Let the community police itself. Give some kind of progression system as you play as a psycop role policing the chat of different games. When a player gets judged for complaints and has hit a certain limit, they should be temporarily banned or depending on how often it happens - permanently. Maybe even reward special items that you can only get during a rift. This would set the game community on the right course.

Good thriller, %75.
The game mechanics are simple, only takes 2-3 hours to learn about killers and survivors, perks and items, add-ons and stuff.

One of the biggest down side is that there is not much way to communicate in the game, i saw only to gestures which is "follow" and "there(with pointy finger of course), it would be nice if you could speak with people in a certain range in the game. I don't think it would break any balance because the killer would be able to hear if he is like in an 8 meters area.

The graphics are not so great, reminds me of source engine, the game is also pretty old so it's normal.

Definetely worth the money, and playing with friends could be fun!

note: The guy with the bell, going invisible, is too unbalanced in my opinion.
